materials.raw_text: Ni: 60 g, Pa: 50 g, Sb: 80 g, Sr: 10 g

sourcing.instructions: Ni: Purchase from a metal supplier or online; Pa: Obtain from a chemical supply store; Sb: Available from specialty metal supply shops; Sr: Sourced from chemical supply retailers.
steps: Ni: Purchase from a metal supplier or online; Pa: Obtain from a chemical supply store; Sb: Available from specialty metal supply shops; Sr: Sourced from chemical supply retailers.

1. Weigh out 60 g of Nickel (Ni) using a precision scale. 2. Weigh 50 g of Palladium (Pa). 3. Measure 80 g of Antimony (Sb). 4. Weigh 10 g of Strontium (Sr). 5. In a clean, dry container, combine all the weighed materials thoroughly using a stainless steel spatula until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 60 g of Nickel (Ni) using a precision scale. 2. Weigh 50 g of Palladium (Pa). 3. Measure 80 g of Antimony (Sb). 4. Weigh 10 g of Strontium (Sr). 5. In a clean, dry container, combine all the weighed materials thoroughly using a stainless steel spatula until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace or high-temperature oven to 800°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible. 3. Place the crucible in the preheated furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace or high-temperature oven to 800°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible. 3. Place the crucible in the preheated furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the components.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally inside the furnace for 4 hours to prevent thermal shock. 3. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally inside the furnace for 4 hours to prevent thermal shock. 3. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Carefully extract the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Carefully extract the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability and prevent oxidation.
